name: Application
description: Represents the Excel application that manages the workbook.

properties.name: calculationMode
properties.description: Returns the calculation mode used in the workbook, as defined by the constants in Excel.CalculationMode. Possible values are: `Automatic`, where Excel controls recalculation; `AutomaticExceptTables`, where Excel controls recalculation but ignores changes in tables; `Manual`, where calculation is done when the user requests it.

properties.name: calculationEngineVersion
properties.description: Returns a number about the version of Excel Calculation Engine that the workbook was last fully recalculated by.

properties.name: calculationState
properties.description: Returns a CalculationState that indicates the calculation state of the application.

methods.name: calculate
methods.description: Recalculate all currently opened workbooks in Excel.

parameters.name: calculationType
parameters.description: Specifies the calculation type to use.

methods.name: suspendApiCalculationUntilNextSync
methods.description: Suspends calculation until the next "context.sync()" is called. Once set, it is the developer's responsibility to re-calc the workbook, to ensure that any dependencies are propagated.

methods.name: suspendScreenUpdatingUntilNextSync
methods.description: Suspends sceen updating until the next "context.sync()" is called.

methods.name: createWorkbook
methods.description: Creates a new hidden workbook by using an optional base64 encoded .xlsx file.

parameters.name: base64File
parameters.description: Optional. The base64 encoded .xlsx file. The default value is null.
